Reviews.Title: “Stay away from room 214”
Reviews.Author: Lamia_fly
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel was very friendly, breakfast was very good, and the location of the hotel is great, but... the mattress was awful (there was a hole of the thousands of people who have already slept there), the shower was either too hot or too cold, and it seemed as if the walls were made out of cardboard, because you could hear everything the neighbors were saying. Perhaps this was only the case for room 214, so if you plan on staying there, just make sure you don't end up in this room.

Reviews.Title: “impressions”
Reviews.Author: Ognjen T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within a residential building and is located on the fourth and fifth floor. The staff was very friendly and always at your service, the location is excellent (near the Spanish Steps), breakfast was satisfactory, mostly sweet, and furniture in the rooms is a little older but everything is clean and tidy. Every day, towels are changed, added to drinks in the mini bar and clean the room ... Recommendations in each case ..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tina M
Reviews.Content: Great location, expensive neibourhood, near Fontana di Trevi & Spanish steps (10 min on foot). Very clean rooms, very gentle & helpful staff. The hotel is the same as you see it in the Internet pictures. We will definitely stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ReviewbyLaura
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable, no frills hotel in the centre of Rome then this is the place for you. Hotel Garda is about a 2 minute walk away from the Spanish Steps and also very close to many other main attractions in Rome. The accommodation is located on the 4th and 5th floors of an 18th Century building. There is a lift to the hotel so you don't have to carry your luggage up the stairs. The hotel is very basic, comprising of a small reception area, lounge area and tiny breakfast area. The breakfast served was also very basic but nice, comprising of croissants (cornetti in Italian!), jam tarts, cereals, juice and coffee made to order. The rooms were very comfortable and modernly decorated, including the ensuite bathroom which was spotless. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as the location was great and it was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: skay3
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern clean rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Good location within five minutes walk of the spanish steps and main shoppping area

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: TheBlackSad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and we basically could not sleep during our stay. First night: we stayed in room 214, which is smaller than other rooms because it's next to housekeeping closet and corridor entrance. We could hear all people coming back late at night, and early in the morning, we could hear the housekeeping persons. On top of that, walls were so thin that we could hear our neighbours (I actually thought they were in the same rooms than us) Cherry on this very bad cake, the shower was not working properly. We obviously complained to the staff (who seemed not to care at all) and stayed in another room the next 2 nights...it was not even better: it was still very noisy, and very bad smell suddenly appeared in the bathroom (there seemed to be an issue with the toilet), which means that we did not sleep at all again. I'm sure there are plenty of decent hotels & B&B at lower price in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS A NICE HOTEL..”
Reviews.Author: celia715
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine..the breakfast was nice,the room was spacious, and the location is perfect.Very close to everything and on the other hand it is at a quiet location.If you don;t look for luxury and just a centrally located hotel that is clean it is your hotel. The only thing that i didn;t like was that it is at a floor,and from the outside it doesn;t remind a hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snoejk
Reviews.Content: From the first day we've arrived, we were heartily welcomed by the receptionist. The reception helped us with all our questions. The rooms were spacious and neat. The breakfast was nice. The hotel has a good location to visit the city. We've enjoyed our stay very much! And last but not least a lot of kisses to Mrs ALESSANDRA. She was very helpful! Fam SNOECK (BELGIUM)

Reviews.Title: “Ok not sure about 3 stars though?”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: On arrival in Rome our transfer from the airport to hotel was 50 minutes late! When we finally got to our Hotel Hotel Centrale we were told that the Italian Agency IMG Incoming had over booked and we had to transfer to Hotel Garda. Another taxi drive away we arrive at our new hotel Hotel Garda. There is only a very small plaque on the wall you could very easily miss the place! You have to ring a buzzer to enter and push a big heavy wooden door. You walk down a long corridor marbled floor to another door and buzzer. Then a lift that fits 2 people or 1 person and a big suitcase upto the 4th floor for reception. The lady on reception checked us in but wasnt interested in helping us out trying to sort our transfer back to the airport out. Our room was very small dark and dingy. It reminded me of a room we had in New York some years ago. There was a small window but no real light came in. There was a mini bar/fridge but you had to move a chair to get in it and it wasnt capable of keeping a bottle of water cold........... The bed was ok but the 1 pillow each wasnt enough they were as flat as pancakes! There was a wardrobe which was that tall you had to use a pole to take your clothes in and out. The bathroom was ok but the toilet was so close to the wall if you were wide or tall your legs would be up the wall! We had plenty of towels and there was shampoo/gel but this wasnt topped up at all in the 4 days we were there. The shower was naff it went hot and cold and the shower head was old and worn so water sprayed all over the place. The room temperature was too hot and stuffy and we only managed to get a remote control for it on our last night which meant a couple of nights being woken up too hot. The room was not noisy and we didnt hear any outside noise. The reception area was clean. All but one member of staff a more senior gentleman were useless they didnt want to help you out. Breakfast! In a small neat and tidy room you were served fresh coffee tea and hot chocolate. Food a cake like a maderia a tart like a treacle/jam tart and 2 types of danish plain and custard which were all nice and fresh. There were also some hard white rolls and some packs of jam and soft cheese. One type of cereal ie cornflakes. Milk and 2 orange juices. No ham or meats. The room had a wiff regardless of whether we left the window open all day or not! The area seemd ok close to the attractions we walked everywhere and a few minutes walk from the Hard Rock Cafe. There is a shop next door and a cafe with outside seating too. One niggle is the WI FI we couldnt always get on it and you have to pay for it! We used the Hard Rock Cafes which was free but you have to show your passport and leave your email address. Not many cafes seem to have it or be willing to let you use it? The only other free place was a The Vatican. It was ok even for a few nights as we were out most of the day and night. You wouldnt want to hang around these rooms in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: wildtiger
Reviews.Content: The location is great! You can take the metro, buses, walk to piazza di spagna (we walked a lot and came back from as far as campo de fiori in the evening). Very convenient for a stroll at the park and to visit galleria Borghese. Great friendly staff, gave us a lot of information. Coffee in the morning is one of the best we had. Price is a lot (around 165 euros) for what you get: the room is small and really basic. I can only justify this seeing the thousands of tourists that fled to the city every day and the high prices of the hotels everywhere. If I was going again I would stay in the same area and maybe at the same hotel. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “totally out of expections”
Reviews.Author: avisintini
Reviews.Content: Web site description and pictures don't tell it is situated at 4th floor of very old residential building. To access you have to ring the street bell at the building gate and across the backyard to reach the lift, in common with the rest of other residents. The hotel itself is very small no more than a bed and breakfast without services, wifi etc, unbelievable how they got the three stars. rooms are very small even if new, walls are so thin that It's like the hosts were sleeping all together. I'm really disappointed as I paid a very high rate, 170euros which is too much for this kind of accommodation. And worst, I realized that only once arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: jdebona
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in at nine in the morning, the gentleman behind the desk stowed our bags and gave us many helpful directions via a map. When we returned that afternoon, our bags were in our room. The morning coffee was excellent-way better than cafes. The location was perfect-not far from Spanish steps, metro, and points down town. Front desk helpful. TIP: I heard on here that it was hard to find. I went on google maps on looked at the street view. It was helpful when getting dropped off by the taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “If you go once, you will want to come again”
Reviews.Author: jonnywhitman
Reviews.Content: Here is what we loved: - Location - especially if you have business at the US Consulate - Flexibility and friendliness of staff - Cleanliness - Free Breakfast (excellent coffee!!) - Comfortable bed - Parking Garage only a block away - Not far from Metro, best way to travel in Rome - Great price Why pay for four stars when you get more with a three star hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Annoyances”
Reviews.Author: lochii
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls and wireless internet you can only buy for three hours at a time, other than that, a pretty decent place in a nice area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Its not perfect, but service was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Angelblue40
Reviews.Content: HOtel Garda looks good from the outside, once you find it. Unfortanately they dont have a big enough sign.(small gold plated plaque approx size of dinner plate, just square) Even our airport transfer guy had trouble finding it too. Once we found it and walked through the massive wooden doors, there was a long passage way. There was no signage so we got a little confused as where to go. But a fellow traveller advised us to take the elevator up to the fourth floor where we were greated by Claudio. This hotel is in a good location - 7 minutes to Spanish Steps, 11 minutes to Trevi Fountain. 5 minutes to train station 15 minutes to the Pantheon. But right next door to the Villa Borgehese. Our room was small, but I expected that in Europe. Bed comfortable.The bathroom was simple but clean and had everything we needed, except maybe a shower curtain. The floor got quite slippery, if we did'nt sit down to shower. Service from this hotel was fantastic right from the very moment I first emailed them, Filipo was nothing but helpful and answered my million & one questions. He arranged my day tours, gave me excellent directions when I wanted to walk to sights. Great tips on local restuarants and even provided an early breakfast for us when we headed off at 6.00am for a day tour to Naples. Nothing was ever too much trouble for Filipo. My recomendation for this hotel would be to give the rooms some brighter decor and lick of new paint and add a much bigger sign outside. Other than that our stay here was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Measy
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, Hotel Garda is relatively good, 10 - 15 minute walk to most central locations. Good variety of restaurants close by. The lobby area and breakfast room is modern however the rooms are extremely small. dingy and old. The bathrooms are ridiculously small and in reality this hotel should be rated at a 2 star rather than 3 star. The single rooms are small and claustrophobic and dark. The breakfast is basic - pastries and bread however you are able to drink freshly made espresso. The staff are very friendly and provide a map on arrival and outline the sights worth seeing and highlight best routes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with Friendly Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChickenSoupWithRice
Reviews.Content: I can not possibly say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Our room had high ceilings with french doors out to a balcony, and was very clean. Of course, as with any big city, the room was on the small side - but who goes to Rome to stay in their hotel room all day? At the desk, they provided us with a map. They also gave great advice on the best way to travel to places we wanted to go and even drew on the map to show us the route! They called a taxi for us when we needed one and spoke English very well. We arrived a little before check-in, and they let us check in early. Breakfast was simple but delicious. (They make your coffee for you fresh by the cup!) Close to Via Veneto and The Borghese Gardens - both of which you should definitely walk. Hotel Garda is also close to a metro stop at Barberini Square. I had no problem taking that stop down to Ancient Rome and all the other historic sites I wanted to see. The Hotel may be a little difficult for you to find, the sign is really small and you have to walk down a hallway in order to actually get to the entrance of the hotel... but that was, for me, part of it's charm! I suggest going on Google Earth and checking the street view of the area so you can recognize it easily once you are actually there in person.

Reviews.Title: “I LIKED IT”
Reviews.Author: HIBS2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location and above all staff is very helpful. I asked for a room with balcony and it was given to me as promised. Breakfast is limited but everything is fresh. Room sizes are also good. Very good restaurants within walking distance. For Nightlife Piazza di Spagna is only 5 mins away. "Anche Roma mi e' piacuta, quando ritorno sicuramente scegliero HOTEL GARDA"

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jimboitaliano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hidden gem, and I do mean hidden. There is a small sign near teh front door that can be easily missed. Once you go in side you will be pleasantly surprised. Hotel was very clean, staff very helpful and friendly. Do not expect to have US standard size rooms, the shower is small but the water is hot. It is worth having a small shower to be within ealking distance of Via Veneto and the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Arrivederci a Roma"”
Reviews.Author: Barba-Bianca
Reviews.Content: In first week of august 09 I spent a couple of days in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Garda. I was familiar with this hotel having worked at the US Embassy in Rome, located only a couple of blocks from the hotel. During my time in Rome I booked several friends and visitors at the Garda and most reported having had a good experience. Now that I experienced the hotel first hand I can honestly report that it provides excellent accommodations at a more than reasonable price, especially considering its location. The hotel is 2 minutes from the Borghese gardens (where one can go jogging), about 5 minutes from Piazza Barberini, 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, next to the famous Via Veneto of the “Dolce Vita” and relatively close to the main train station, Termini. Although it is centrally located it very quiet and easy to get to sleep. The breakfast is the typical continental type with fresh pastry, good coffee, and friendly service. The manager Filippo could not be nicer. Restaurants of all price ranges are within walking distance, one right off the exit of the building. I tried La Bruschetta on Via Sardegna and Vladimir's right around the corner. Also close are the Borghese and many other museums, cultural, and historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for those who travel to Rome for the 1st time”
Reviews.Author: Tonia-Athens
Reviews.Content: We went to Garda at the end of January and i want to sent a special thanks to a previous traveler that wrote instructions on how to find the hotel. the instructions were very usesful. Regarding the hotel, its location is very convinient as you can visit most of the sights on foot. I should recommend to any next visitor to ask for a renovated room as not all the rooms are like the ones on the hotel's site. Our room was pretty old but clean. Moreover, the hotel's personnel is very kind and helpful. As an overall comment, I would say that garda hotel is a good choice for travelers going to Rome for the 1st time, are planning to stay 2-3 nights and are not looking for romance inside the hotel. Enjoy your staying in a beautiful city like Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,clean good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Habilli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location very close to Piazza del Popolo, the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese and the Trevi Fountain. Barberini metro station is also very close. It is in a very safe neighborhood. I also walked from Rome Termini Railway station to Hotel Garda. The room I stayed in was clean and very good size. The breakfast was very basic consist of pastries, cheese and butter but they have a very nice lady preparing coffee for you. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel don’t stay there as it is a basic hotel which provided very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice!”
Reviews.Author: DaizyB
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a few night's at the Hotel Garda and found it more than satisfactory for the price. The rooms are admittedly small and not terribly elegant but they are very clean and comfortable and even the little single room had high ceilings and a big window that opened out with a view of the street. The common areas are neatly furnished and the effect is very modern and pleasant. The staff could not have been nicer. they were available 24 hours and seemed happy to help with any suggestions or problems. The location is absolutely ideal! It is just a few short blocks to some of the best shopping, dining and sightseeing in Rome. The Hotel Garda itself is not particularly romantic but if you are traveling alone or with friends it is safe, clean, well-appointed and ideally situated for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Curiously unique”
Reviews.Author: 0z4me
Reviews.Content: Avoid room 104, it has a view over the stairs and lift shaft with no natural daylight. This resulted in a dull and uninviting room, with no ventilation. Shower tiny and not much water pressure. Other rooms we peeped into were again clean but small and gloomy. Hotel itself difficult to find, basically an anonymous shared entrance, leading into a long corridor, onto another barred gate behind which is the lift upto the hotel reception on the 4th floor. Hotel reception light and airy with modern decor. Reception staff great - fantastic tip re. entrance to Colloseum, i.e. buy tickets at Roman forum before walking down to the Colloseum, straight past its massive ticket queue and in! Basically given full and tailored guide to the city - great. Breakfast, not special - basic, fresh danish pastries and coffee - the Italian way (according to the guide book).

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ZaraEngland
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the builiding and lobby looked lovely and even the reception area of the hotel was nicely decorated. The room, however, was not so good feeling cramped and gloomy. The bathroom was appalling - think cracked tiles and the shower was tiny and was just like turning on a tap full blast and standing under it. To add insult to injury, the shower door kept falling off too! Breakfast was just OK - not a lot of choice but the croissants were fresh. All in all, I would rate this hotel more of a 2* than 3*. Good if you want to be near to the Via Veneto, but I'm afraid that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 100ktraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel confirmed one rate in writing and charged me another (higher) price when I went to pay the bill. Said they couldn't do anything about it. Left me feeling pretty bad about it and well taken advantage of by people who seemed so friendly at first... Stay somewhere else. Go out and eat a proper breakfast and skip the Garda's cheap breads.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good value!”
Reviews.Author: crackerman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great 3 days staying at Hotel Garda, which is in a great location for sightseeing with the main sights only a short walk away. The room was very clean and the hotel was well maintained. The entrance is not immediately obvious as the hotel is situated on the top floors of a building on Via Lombardia. However, just bear this in mind and keep your eye out for number 30 and it is not a problem at all. The hotel was excellent value in comparison to others that I could find in a similar area, and the service was great. All staff were friendly and could speak English very well, and were eager to help with advice on sightseeing and provide very good restaurant recommendations. The restaurant Piccolo Mondo just around the corner (left out of the entrance) was superb. As far as the reviews before mine criticising the breakfast...If you're expecting a full english, you won't find this in any hotel here, the breakfast served at this hotel is typical and sufficient. A selection of fresh croissants, brioche, fresh rolls, french toast are available along with juices and excellent coffee! This was more than enough and according to my guidebook, was typically Italian. Rooms are not huge, but in my experience this is the case in most capital cities on this sort of budget. Not luxurious, but good value and a perfect base to return to after a long day of sightseeing! I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Poor breakfast, noisy room, horrible hotel rules”
Reviews.Author: Frooglevacationer
Reviews.Content: The breakfast consisted of cold croissants and grapefruit juice. The coffee selection was good but I had to have a follow up breakfast after I left. I was not allowed to have a person in my room for a few hours. I had booked a single room and my guest had to pay off the front desk guy off to stay with me for a couple of hours. He was more nosey and strict than my own mother. The bathroom was neat and clean as was the room.

Reviews.Title: “If not the location...”
Reviews.Author: _Wanderer__24242_
Reviews.Content: The best thing about hotel Garda is the location – 30 meters from via Veneto, in a lovely and safe neighbourhood. Transport connections are good (if they can be good in Rome), with metro stations Barberini and Spagna within 10 minutes walking distance and numerous bus stops even closer to the hotel. There is a big GS grocery store near the hotel - in the undeground passage leading to metro station Spagna. Now to less enjoyable points. Access to the hotel from the street is inconvenient and complicated: one has to pass through at least 3 barriers. First, there is a front door, which is usually closed, so one has to ring the bell to get the receptionist to open the door. After that, there is a long hallway with another door at the end, and the same procedure is needed to open it. Then one has to take a rather slow elevator to the 5th floor where hotel’s reception is. Finally, with the room key received from the reception, one may need to climb the stairs one floor up (hotel rooms are situated on 5th and 6th floors of the building). All in all the procedure of getting in or out of the hotel takes several minutes and, when repeated several times a day, becomes tiresome. My single room was of a decent size but had some problems that made the stay less enjoyable than it could have been otherwise. The bed was inconvenient – too small and too soft. The blanket was an old woollen one, also inconvenient, as it was difficult to keep it over the sheet that served as a blanket cover. Bathroom was small and had an inconvenient layout. Worse, there was a problem with water – it was neither hot enough nor cold enough, always something in the middle. The pressure was extremely poor and it took time for the water to warm up. The shower cabin was old and inconvenient. The room had a mini-bar and an old, small TV (with two English language channels – BBC and CNN). The window overlooked a narrow courtyard. My room had yet another problem – every evening there was a distinct mechanical noise coming from within the building (as if some machinery was operated somewhere). This noise would disappear around midnight, but was quite annoying before that. Also, all noises in the corridor or neighbouring rooms were clearly heard in the room. Hotel’s public areas seem to have been recently renovated and look nice, especially the reception and the breakfast room. My rate (60 euro/night) included breakfast, which I never had, (couldn't find anything edible there). The breakfast offer consists of coffee, croissants and low-quality flakes. Hotel staff was generally friendly, except for the lady that seems to be in charge of other staff, who was somewhat pushy. They are not all knowledgeable about Rome however – I once asked for directions to one very well known attraction near Rome and the advice I got was of little value. Other receptionists were more knowledgeable, though. One tip: one can get a lower price by booking directly from the hotel web site just before the stay (some kind of last minute discount). In conclusion, at 60 euro/night hotel Garda is good value for money, but only due to very good location. Otherwise, lots of minor inconveniencies spoiled my stay, so I will probably not consider Garda again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Garda and general Rome info”
Reviews.Author: SueWorcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Garda and booked with Easy to book and sure enough they were! The hotel location is excellent as it is just off the Via Veneto, a curving road with nice shops and restaurants. It is also 5 mins walk from the lovely Parc Borghese, so for those who seek a respite from the city - here is perfect. You can hire bikes and rickshaws and the Galleria Borghese, located in the park, is considered one of the most important museums in the world. It is stuffed full of works by Bellini, Canova and a Reubens that you can get right up close to.However you must book in advance and arrive 30 minutes early otherwise you don't get in. Also near are the famous Spanish steps. At the bottom are fantastic shops - Dior, Gucci, Armani etc. Check them out just to see how the other half live! With regards to the hotel - it is quiet and safe as it is 4 floors up. There is no problem coming back late as reception are on duty 24 hours a day. The reception were particularly helpful, providing maps and information and advice. Breakfast was adequate for us juice, coffee, rolls, croissants. The room was fine, but as some visitors had previously mentioned the shower does not come with curtain, howver provided you were careful it was possible to have a shower without soaking the whole room. Rome is fantastic. I was surprised how much is within walking distance. Definitely recommend the Travestere area, just wander round the streets to get a glimpse of the working life of Rome. The catacombs on the outskirts are good also, again would recommend the walk along the Appia Antica - the old road into Rome, very atmospheric and again a chance to escape the buzz of the city. We used the Terravision bus when we arrived. If you have children buy the tickets at the terminal in Rome and not on the plane they are cheaper. On return to the airport we just asked about buses at the booth outside the train station advertising bus tickets. They sold us even cheaper tickets than Terravsion and our child went free. 12 Euros in total for 3 of us. We felt very safe in Rome, although of course we were careful when travelling amongst the crowds. The buses and metro are great, cheap and easy to use. If you go to the Colosseum with a child take thier passport so you can take advantage of reduced price. We paid for a guide, they are situated outside the Colesseum and they say you don't have to queue. This isn't strictly true as everyone has to go through a scanner for security purposes and this can take some time. Our guide was quite informative but we only stopped in 2 places and she read it all out of a book! For anyone interested in plants take a visit to the botanical gardens - very pretty lots of interesting trees, palms, cacti etc. It's about 1 1/2 miles from the Vatican. All in all a great trip, we love Italy and once again we came back wanting more! FANTASTICO!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE experience - stay away!”
Reviews.Author: SheriM
Reviews.Content: After staying at two other nice hotels in Italy, we had the misfortune of staying at Hotel Garda on our last 2 nights. The lobby looked OK, which was deceiving. Our room was a TINY triple, with 3 beds within inches of each other, two of them with a tacky mirror headboard. There were various dirty smears on the walls and the carpet was filthy. We had to ask how to use our TV and make a special request to get the air conditioner controller. We called the front desk 3 times one evening, but could not get anyone to answer. The bathroom consisted of a moldy tub with no curtain and a filthy floor. The toilet ran and ran one night, keeping us awake. We heard another guest complaining in the hall to a member of hotel staff about loud unexplained noises. The maid service was a complete joke and consisted of nothing more than re-making the beds with the same linen (since we found a piece of our own laundry made INTO the bed) and leaving some new towels behind. The maid also moved our luggage around, when there was no need to, since they did NOT vacuum. The "free breakfast" was nothing more than cold cereal and a surly woman serving bad coffee. What a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Londoner27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights over the May bank holiday weekend and had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location: just off the Via Veneto, 2 minutes from the Borghese gardens, about 5 minutes from Piazza Barberini, 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, yet very quiet and easy to get to sleep. The room was spotlessly clean, the decor was modern (flat screen TV and air conditioning panel were a nice touch), the bathroom was more spacious than those I've encountered in far more upmarket places and the shower was excellent. The breakfast did not have a huge choice but the coffee was good and there were some nice pastries. I would happily stay here again or recommend it to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: LinnMarie
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for my 18th birthday with 2 of my friends. We decided to stay at the Hotel Garda despite reading bad reviews about it as the location sounded perfect to us, and we wouldn't be in the hotel much anyway. With reading the bad reviews I was expecting the worst but when I arrived realised it was not what some people seemed to think it was. We got a taxi from the airport which cost no more than 25 euros, the taxi driver knew exactly where the hotel was so we had no problems finding the place. When he dropped us off we were a little confussed to start off with as it's on a backstreet and there was no obvious sign to say that it's there but our taxi driver quickly realised and told us which door to go in. The Hotel Garda is on the 3rd floor of a building which has other hotels in aswell, we liked this as it made the hotel seem very safe. As soon as we arrived the man at the check in gave us all a free map each, circled all the places he thought us 3 teenage girls would enjoy, circled some that he wasn't so sure we'd enjoy as much but told us they were extremely beautiful so if we had time we should go see them, and he also wrote down all the buses we would need to get to all these places and where the bus stops were then drew out the quickest route to get everywhere. He also booked us a taxi to get us back to the airport. We thought this was all extremely nice of him as we didn't ask him to. The hotel itself is quite modern but basic, what you'd expect for a cheap hotel. It was perfectly fine to live in for a few days though, a lot better than we expected. The only fault that I have about this hotel is that the shower in our room was extremely hot for about half an hour and it was a bit like someone chucking a bucket of water over you. My friends seemed to think the shower was fine but as I was the first one in and had to stand under the extreme heat I didn't enjoy it as much. The only other thing is that trying to open the main door when you've had a few drinks was a little tricky and it took us about half an hour to get in, it kept us all amused however including the receptionist who had to keep buzzing us in while we tried to open the door. The breakfast at Hotel Garda was very nice I thought, the reviews I'd read said the coffee was disgusting so I didn't dare try that but everything else was nice enough. The best thing about the hotel is the location though, despite the receptionist being so kind to tell us all the buses we decided to walk absolutely everywhere as the hotel is quite close to most things, the furthest thing away that we went to was the colloseum and that only took us about 45 minutes. I would definitely stay here again. Sorry that this is so long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Good Location. You could walk to TREVI FOUNTAIN in 10-15 mins and to the SPANISH STEPS in the same amount of time. There was a tourist bus stop 5 mins walk away near Barberini Metro. Rooms clean and suitable (our room happened to be the same size as any premier travel inn or travelodge back in the UK). Reception staff were brilliant and very helpful. We would stay here again and can't wait to go back...........Good value for money at the price we paid through alpha rooms. OK breakfast was basic but a coffee and pastries is fine by us

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryanne30
Reviews.Content: After searching through many hotels, we decided on Hotel Garda for a few reasons- the location, air conditioning, a bathroom in the room and the price. We wanted a hotel in the the center of Rome that made it easy to walk every where and was close enough so we could take some afternoon naps. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but comfortable. It is not a luxury hotel, but a comfortable one. The staff was helpful, the air conditioning worked and the breakfast was good. It was in a location that made all spots accessible by foot or metro. You aren't getting a king size bed, chocolate on the pillows and a marble lobby. You're getting a very comfortable hotel ina great location. I def. recomend it:)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Garda is ingreat location, but... expensive Hotel, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_and_family
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, near Villa Borgese Park in Rome, and if you don't mind a bit of walking, it is a good central location for a Rome sight seeing tour (even if next time we would go to the area North of Termini which seems a much cheaper and less touristy place, but not as dangerous as the South side of Termini. However, whilst the room did it's purpose, and cost 200 euros a night for a family of 4 which seems normal for Rome, the breakfast was very basic, and had the worst coffee we had on the whole of our Italian trip. (I even prefer the horrible instant stuff you get in UK). I don't want to paint too bad of a picture, the staff (except for the poor stressed lady serving breakfast by herself) were very friendly and helpful, and at the front desk 24 hours. They all spoke English, which is useful even if not always essential (I like Italy to feel Italian), and the room wasn't dirty, although it was the only Italian hotel we saw with carpets, and old ones too! but overall it did it's job. We won't stay there on our next visit to Rome, even if they said we could get a 10% discount for paying cash if we had asked in advance. However, they would not give it us this time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome...”
Reviews.Author: CR-HC-M.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned back from a lovely weekend in Rome. What an amazing place! Hotel Garda where we stayed was a different experience to what we were expecting, BUT it wasn't unpleasant in fact far from it...very clean and modern, with helpful staff. Only a few things niggled my husband and i which were: There was no coffee/tea facilities in the room, nor could you get one from downstairs,unless at breakfast time! No Hotel Bar, Very tasty BUT simple breakfast...coffee and croissants...thats it! If you dont like lifts you would not like the entry to the hotel! Four floors to the reception desk plus one to get to your room! Lots of marble steps or a lift! The location is fantastic! So cant grumble here! Hard to find the hotel though on arrival.. One tip look for Helen's perfumery and the hotel is next-door...look for the small gold plaque on the wall in between the apartment numbers ! We would use this hotel again as we discovered from speaking to people we had a good deal. An overall great Break. Mr & Mrs M, Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: NDChicago
Reviews.Content: Reception staff was great...spoke perfect English and were very helpful. Room was clean though it smelled like stale cigarettes. Within walking distance of all major attractions and very close to a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “First Time”
Reviews.Author: Born4travel
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 3 nights. Once we found our way into the hotel we found the reception staff most helpful re-the area & what to see & full info on the hotel. The hotel is still being refurbished, but the parts that we had access to were very clean & modern. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard. The hotel is situated in a good area with easy access, to most of the tourist attractions, on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Garda for 8 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. The location is great; walking distance to most sites and the neighborhood is fabulous with lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff were always helpful and in some cases, absolutely superb. Very friendly. The rooms are typical of European hotels of this class. Nothing fancy but perfectly functional. The hotel was undergoing renovations while we were there (new tile in the hall, new hall ceiling, new room doors and frames). The results look great. The bathrooms look to be recently upgraded. Shower is small but functional. Bathtub is luxurious, but there's no shower curtain...you have to be handy with the hand-held shower sprayer. The breakfast is good, but spare (choice of two kinds of rolls, one kind of cereal and juice). Don't order the American style coffee...brutal! But, the cappucino and the espresso were great. Note: The hotel is on the 4th floor of its building. No big sign out front, just a brass plaque.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we loved the hotel. they were remodeling while we were there and we got one of the new rooms! it was gorgeous and spacious! perfect location right down the street from the spanish steps! it was on a quiet street, away from the noises of the city. it was inside a locked building and felt very safe. the staff was courteous and accomodating. would definitely stay here again, would love to see what it looks like now!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the garda for 3 nights in october 2005 and would definitely stay there again. the main thing about the hotel is the location, about 5 minutes walk from the spanish steps, and amongst plenty of bars and resteraunts (the pizza place next door was particularly good, and quite cheap as well). the hotel itself is quite basic, but clean, and the staff are very helpful and speak english. the were only a couple of minor problems. the TV had no english channels and the dressing table had no mirror, which annoyed the wife a little. however, we have no hesitation in recommending the garda as a good value base to enjoy your stay in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel not only in price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome on a family vacation. My husband and I and our 2 children. Hotel is hard to find. Our driver even had a problem finding this hotel. However, is close to all the sites of Rome. Rooms are very small with only the basics. Staff was a little too nosey for me. The desk clerk even followed us to our room one night. (I don't know what they thought we were doing?) Maid service was horrible. Maid actually inspected our room every day to check for damages. Don't know what damages they were looking for, we were hardly ever in the room. Just took a shower and slept at night. They tried to make us pay for stuff upon checking out that they said we did to the room. We refused! Upon entering this hotel the wall paper is peeling off the walls in the hallway. The walls in our room were covered with dust. The air conditioning didn't work. When we complained about the air conditioner they said it worked just fine. After a few days of a air conditioner that blew only warm air, my husband took the cover off and fixed it himself (was just a minor problem of no water in it). Apparently the air conditioning in Rome requires water to work. Like I said the hotel is in a great location, however, the hotel itself leaves something to be desired. Also, the photos on their site must have been taken 20 years ago. I would only recommend this hotel for the location. Not a 3 star hotel in my book. Maybe a 1 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Grace in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Garda from May 28 through June 6 and had a wonderful time. Even though listed as a 3-Star hotel, the service I received was as gracious as any 5-Star I have stayed in. The entire staff was personable, courteous and professional and they all extended the utmost hospitality and grace to me. They treated me like a relative they hadn't seen in a long time, and they went out of their way to assist me in any way possible; whether it was restaurant or cafe recommendations, reserving a taxi for me, giving me directions, keeping my room clean and well-stocked, or furnishing me with a wake-up call, they were sincere in their efforts to make me as comfortable as possible. I truly looked forward to the morning breakfast buffet, which included the best cappuchino I have had anywhere! I would recommend this place for a single woman, traveling solo (as I was), for families with children, for couples, or for anyone who wants to experience the true hospitality of Rome, whether for business or pleasure. It's centrally located, right off the Via Veneto, with all the dining and shopping choices you could want. My room was a clean single, with a small balcony, which included a comfy single bed, private bath and air conditioning. The price was more than fair and I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “plain simple but nice”
Reviews.Author: joy&william
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at hotel Garda in Rome, it's a small but very nice hotel at via Lombardia 30 , the rooms aren't that big, the furniture is indeed a bit dated, such as the shower but the people are very friendly and helpfull, and that made our stay in Rome so much nicer. So hopefully as we return to Rome, afterall we did trow a nickle in the Trevi fountain we will be able to stay at a refurnished hotel Garda. Greetings Will and Joy Holland
